data: Refer to latest BC CDC – COVID-19 Therapeutics Committee Guidelines for most up-to-date criteria

Contraindications and Cautions: 
- Severe renal disease (eGFR less than 30 mL/min or dialysis) 
- End-stage liver disease (Child-Pugh C, cirrhosis) 
- Hypersensitivity to nirmatrelvir or ritonavir or other protease inhibitors 
- Hepatitis B and C, or HIV infection regardless of treatment status -- Infectious Disease Consultation is recommended 
- Significant drug-drug interactions: (See Practice Tool 3: Drug Interactions and Contraindications for more details)  
- Nirmatrelvir-ritonavir increases the levels of fentanyl and risk of fatal overdose. Persons with opioid use disorder require counselling and/or expert consultation 
- Nirmatrelvir and ritonavir are potent inhibitors of CYP 3A4 and increase the concentration of many drugs metabolized by this enzyme 
- Contraindicated with drugs that are potent CYP3A inducers where significantly reduced nirmatrelvir or ritonavir plasma concentrations may be associated with the potential for loss of virologic response and possible resistance 
- Hormonal birth control: Back-up contraception methods should be used due to decreased levels of estrogen in estrogen-containing contraceptives
300 mg PO BID, order duration:  5 days, Drug Form Kit
100 mg PO BID, order duration:  5 days, Drug Form Kit
150 mg PO BID, order duration:  5 days, Drug Form Kit
100 mg PO BID, order duration:  5 days, Drug Form Kit
